dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8250 IH: Copyright Clause Restoration Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Steube introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To address the duration of copyright, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Copyright Clause Restoration Act of 2022.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any provision of title 17, United States Code, or any other provision of law, copyright in any work shall endure for 28 years from the date it was originally secured.

The holder of a copyright under paragraph (1) shall be entitled to a renewal and extension of the copyright in the applicable work for a further term of 28 years if the holder applies for that renewal and extension during the 1-year period before the expiration of the original term of the copyright under that paragraph.
Except as provided in paragraph (2), subsection (a) shall apply with respect to copyright protection for any work fixed on or after the date of enactment of this Act.

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B), subsection (a) shall apply with respect to a copyright that, on any date on or after May 1, 2022, is owned by a person that—

clause.text: has a market capitalization of more than $150,000,000,000; and

subclause.text: is classified under North American Industry Classification System code 5121 or 71; or
engages in substantial activities for which a code described in subclause (I) could be assigned.

subparagraph.text: If, as of May 1, 2022, a person is operating under a license with respect to a copyright that is subject to subparagraph (A) and that, because of the application of that subparagraph, would expire during the 10-year period beginning on May 1, 2022, that person shall continue to hold the rights contained in that license (to the exclusion of any person not granted those rights by a license before May 1, 2022) for a period that is the shorter of—

clause.text: 50 percent of the remaining license term, as of May 1, 2022; or
